text: The splenial is a small bone in the lower jaw of reptiles, amphibians and birds, usually located on the lingual side (closest to the tongue) between the angular and suprangular.Romer, A. S. (1956). Osteology of the Reptiles. 772 pp. Chicago & London.Watson, D. M. S. (1912). LXVII.—On some reptilian lower jaws. Journal of Natural History, 10(60), 573-587. Splenial Bone ==References== Category:Vertebrate anatomy
title: Splenial
